intro: Megalastrum fibrillosum, commonly known as the fibrous mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that thrives on the branches of specific host trees. It possesses a unique structure with a flattened, leaf-like stem covered in fine, fibrous filaments. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are typically clustered together. Its seeds are dispersed by birds that consume the fleshy, red berries. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the health of its host tree if left unchecked.
